intro: Tilia grandifolia f. praestabilis, commonly known as the large-flowered lime, is a variant of the smallleaf linden. It is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that are typically 8–15 cm in length. The flowers are pale yellow and appear in clusters, blooming in early summer. This variety is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to grow in temperate climates. It prefers well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight.
